III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth reported a staff member provided him with alcohol on
10/30/2023.
Additional Allegation: Youth witnessed staff drinking vodka while
working.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant/Director was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility, on November 1, 2023, in collaboration with the
MDHHS worker. Director said she received a phone call the
evening of October 30, 2023, from Staff 3 stating Youth A told her
that he had been drunk that day from alcohol that was provided to
him by a staff member who he refused to name. Director said she
directed the staff on shift to take Youth A to the emergency room
for a drug/alcohol screen and to write an incident report. Director
said Youth A had been struggling throughout the day on October
30, 2023, noting there were several incident reports about his
behaviors from that day. Director said Youth A’s behaviors have
included AWOL, refusing to follow program expectations, and
threatening to harm staff including raping female staff. Director
said Youth A has been placed on a one-to-one “observation”
status with a male staff member and if a male is not available, they
are having two female staff with Youth A at all times. Director said
she is typically at the facility during daytime hours and has a lot of
interaction with Staff 1. Director said Staff 1 wears a mask during
all her shifts. Director said she has no knowledge of Staff 1
drinking alcohol while at work, either firsthand, from staff, or youth.
Director said she has never had any concerns about Staff 1’s
behaviors at work.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at school, on November
1, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said
he has been placed at Wolverine Center for about three weeks.
Youth A said the staff have been “making up lies” about him to get
him into trouble. Youth A said a few days ago he was talking to
another youth about girlfriends and that youth said he was going
to “rape” his girlfriend “if he ever got one”. Youth A denied ever
saying he would rape anyone. Youth A said he did ask Staff 3 if
2

she “liked to role play” and she told him that was inappropriate
and then made up a lie that he was drinking and made him go to
the hospital for a drug/alcohol test when he was not drinking.
Youth A denied drinking while at Wolverine and denied any staff
member ever providing him alcohol. Youth A said it is the “staff”
that drink at Wolverine. Youth A said he came out of his room and
walked past a staff, and she smelled like “vodka” and then poured
something into a cup and put a mask on. Youth A said he then
asked to go outside, and she told him “No” to which he responded
it was because she was “drunk” which upset her, and she told him
she was going to “write IR’s on him”. Youth A said he is unsure of
the staff’s name however said she always wears a yellow shirt and
has curly red hair. Youth A said this was the only time he saw a
staff drinking.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at school, on November
1, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said
he was staying on the same floor as Youth A previously however
was moved to a different floor so was not present on October 30,
2023, and has no knowledge of Youth A drinking. Youth B said
prior to moving to a different floor he was present when he and
Youth A saw Staff 1 drinking. Youth B said he saw her drinking,
smelled like vodka, her eyes were “getting dark”, and when he
confronted her about drinking, she put a mask on. Youth B said
this was the only time he saw Staff 1 or any other staff drinking
alcohol.
Operation Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility, on November 1, 2023, in collaboration with the
MDHHS worker. Operation Manager said she was not working on
Monday, October 30, 2023, and was not involved in the incident
with Youth A. Operation Manager said she supervises the
supervisors at the facility. Operation Manager said she has worked
many shifts with Staff 1 and has never seen her drinking on the
job or heard from other staff or youth that Staff 1 has drank alcohol
while working. Operation Manager said she has never had any
concerns about Staff 1’s behaviors while at work. Operation
Manager said Staff 1 wears a mask during all her shifts, noting
many other employees do as well. Operation Manager said Youth
A has been at Wolverine Center for a few weeks and has been
saying many things about staff and other youth that are not true.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
November 1, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
When Staff 1 was interviewed she entered the room wearing a
mask and kept it on throughout the interview. Staff 1 said she was
3

not working on October 30, 2023, therefore did not have anything
to do with Youth A’s incident that day. Staff 1 said she is a
supervisor during first shift and works with all the youth however is
not normally assigned to one floor. Staff 1 said Youth A did accuse
her of drinking alcohol during a Saturday shift. Staff 1 said Youth A
had been struggling that day and making up allegations about
other youth, other staff, as well as her. Staff 1 denied ever drinking
alcohol that day or anytime she works. Staff 1 said she always
wears a mask when she is at work.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
November 1, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 said she was working with Youth A during the school hours
on October 30, 2023. Staff 2 said Youth A did not have odd
behaviors during the day. Staff 2 said she had no concern that
Youth A was drunk or under the influence of any substance. Staff 2
said Youth A did not smell of alcohol. Staff 2 said Youth A had a
good day at school until the very end of the day when everyone
was getting ready to leave and go back to the facility. Staff 2 said
Youth A went to the bathroom and when he came out she was
“playing around” with Youth B and Youth B accidently bumped into
Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth A thought Staff 1 pushed Youth B into
him and he became really mad and threated to hit Staff 1 in the
face along with other comments about beating her up. Staff 1 said
Youth A seemed to calm down while on the way back to Wolverine
Center however once back at the facility he began to threaten to
hurt her again. Staff 2 said Youth A was brought up to his floor and
she was able to leave as it was the end of her shift.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on November 1, 2023,
and November 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS
worker. Staff 3 said she was working with Youth A on October 30,
2023. Staff 3 said when she got into work Youth A was in his room
asleep. Staff 3 said that is not uncommon and at times Youth A
would take a nap after school. Staff 3 said Youth A eventually
awoke and he told her that he was drunk earlier that day at school
and when he came back to Wolverine Center he “nutted up” on all
the staff. Staff 3 said “nutted up” meant that he was being
intimidating and scaring staff with his threats. Staff 3 said Youth A
said he received the alcohol from staff but refused to tell her which
staff had provided it. Staff 3 said she then took Youth A and the
other youth on his floor to the common area downstairs. Staff 3
said at bedtime she took Youth A and the other youth back to the
second floor to prepare for bed. Staff 3 said Youth A asked the
other youth what he was going to do when he got a girlfriend and
he responded he was going to “rape her”. Staff 3 said she
4

intervened and told that youth it was not ok to rape anyone to
which Youth A stated “it’s ok, I am going to do it to. Ain’t that right
[Staff3]?” and then proceeded to walk over to her and pull her hair.
Staff 3 said she told Youth A he was being inappropriate, and he
needed to go to his room for bedtime. Staff 3 said Youth A refused
to go into his room and was walking around the hallway. Staff 3
said Youth A then walked over to her and said, “do you like to role
play?” to which she told him he was being completely
inappropriate and needed to go to his room. Staff 3 said she called
the supervisor and he came to the second floor and she went
down to the first floor to work the remainder of her shift. Staff 3
said she did not suspect Youth A to be under the influence of any
alcohol or drugs during her shift. Staff 3 said Youth A was brought
to the hospital by another staff that evening for an alcohol
screening. Staff 3 said she has worked some shifts with Staff 1
and has never had any concern about her drinking alcohol while at
work or being at work under the influence of alcohol. Staff 3 said
she has never seen any staff provide alcohol to any youth. Staff 3
said she has never heard or had concern of staff members
providing alcohol to any youth.
Clinical Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility,
on November 1, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS
worker. Clinical Director said he provides direct therapy to Youth
A. Clinical Director said Youth A will come to the sessions but does
not actively engage in the therapy process. Clinical Director said
Youth A has been in treatment for several years and does not see
a value in participation. Clinical Director said Youth A often tells
him that he “hates all staff” but does not provide specific staff or
reasons for this. Clinical Director said Youth A has never disclosed
drinking alcohol while at Wolverine Center or having staff provide
him with alcohol. Clinical Director said Youth A has never told him
of any staff drinking while on the job. Clinical Director said he
works first shift and has had many interactions over the year with
Staff 1. Clinical Director said he has never seen Staff 1 present
with concerning behaviors and has never seen her drinking or
thought she was under the influence of alcohol at work.
Teacher was interviewed via telephone, on November 17,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Teacher said he
is employed for Capstone Academy and works Monday through
Friday teaching the Wolverine Center youth. Teacher said he was
working on October 30, 2023. Teacher said he did not smell any
alcohol on Youth A. Teacher said he did not have any concerns
about Youth A being drunk at school on October 30, 2023, or any
other day. Teacher said he has never seen any staff provide
5

alcohol to Youth A or any other youth, stating if he did, he would
call law enforcement and notify the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated October 30, 2023, 2:30pm, regarding
Youth A. The incident report documented the concerns
about Youth A becoming upset and verbally aggressive and
threatening towards staff and the school. The incident
report is consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Incident Report dated October 30, 2023, 8:10pm, regarding
Youth A. The incident report documented Youth A’s
disclosure of being drunk at school that day, threats to rape
staff, and inappropriate comments to staff about role
playing, the incident report is consistent with Staff 3’s
interview.
• Incident Report dated October 30, 2023, 7:00pm, regarding
Youth A. The incident report documented Youth A’s
statements while at the hospital that he “filed abuse
charges” so that the staff “better stop playing with me” and
his statement that he “is going to tell everything at court”.
• Incident Report dated October 30, 2023, 10:13pm,
regarding Youth A. The report documented a room search
of Youth A’s room and only finding one sandal and no other
contraband in the room.
• Youth A’s medical records from Ascension St. John Hospital
dated October 30, 2023. The records indicate a visit to the
hospital and Youth A’s vitals during the appointment, as well
as a negative screen for alcohol.
• Wolverine Human Services Employee Standards of
Conduct Policy was reviewed on November 28, 2023.
There is not specific language about not providing alcohol
to youth however the policy outlines an expectation for staff
to maintain professionalism while working for Wolverine
Center.
• Wolverine Human Services Substance Abuse Policy was
reviewed on November 29, 2023. The policy outlines the
employees’ expectations to not be under the influence of
any controlled substances, illegal drugs or alcohol on
Wolverine’s premises.
• Youth A’s Parent/Agency Treatment Plan (PATP) for July
14, 2023, through October 11, 2023, was reviewed in
MiSACWIS. The PATP reported Youth A being caught using
a marijuana vape pen but no other known experimentation
with substances. The report stated that Youth A “seems to
be in a slow mental health decline, going from hopeful to
not caring. He has had multiple delusions that the
6

court/lawyer are telling him things that are not happening,
believing in conspiracy theories that everyone is out to get
him. Counselor at the time recommended inpatient
treatment for stabilization.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with staff qualifications. There is
no evidence that a staff member provided alcohol to Youth A.
There is no evidence that Staff 1 was drinking alcohol or under the
influence while working at Wolverine Center.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
